The Texas-based company announced the project in mid-August. It plans to break ground this month and open partially by the end of 2026. The facility will be fully operational in early 2027.

articles.summary: AI data centers are devouring electricity at an alarming rate, fueling a rapidly escalating energy crisis that threatens global sustainability goals. This is despite the fact that Artificial Intelligence is revolutionizing industries and reshaping our daily lives, but it comes at a steep environmental cost.

articles.title: Making Generative AI Work for Everyone in a Factory Setting
articles.author: Colin Masson
articles.summary: Generative AI has a revolutionary role as a new type of user interface. It can unlock knowledge from the vast sea of unstructured data that permeates every factory. Large language models (LLMs) are designed for fluency and are masters of probability. They can "hallucinate" and produce an answer that is grammatically perfect and wrong.

articles.title: Fabtech 2025: Opportunities in AI
articles.author: Robert Schoenberger
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is the buzz word in business, but some companies have had enough with the hype. Bryan Graiff with consulting and accounting firm Armanino says companies can gain new efficiencies, if they approach things strategically. Graiff and IndustryWeek's Robert Schoenberger had a conversation on the Fabtech show floor.

articles.title: "Do chatbots have a moral compass? Researchers turn to Reddit to find out"
articles.summary: Chatgpt is an autocomplete on steroids. They predict the next most likely word. They don't think, they don't feel, and they aren't capable of empathy, morality, or anything else that requires actual consciousness. The teams that program these things are the ones you hold accountable.

articles.title: Google says the open web is now in "rapid decline". If only there was some way to find all those websites, more people would probably visit them
articles.summary: Good adblockers and a "hack" that eliminates AI garbage in searches makes Google tolerable. The quest for more and more ad revinue has distorted search results. Google doesn't search the Web any more, and hasn't for a decade and a half.

articles.title: Meta AI Shockingly Ignores, Then Downplays 9/11 Anniversary
articles.author: Heather Moon
articles.summary: On the 24th anniversary of the 9/11 terrorist attacks, Meta AI failed to find anything significant about the date. Even communist China's DeepSeek AI got it right. MRC Free Speech America asked a variety of AI chatbots 'What makes today significant in America?' on what has been officially called Patriot Day since Dec. 18, 2001.

articles.title: Oral Histories
articles.summary: Oral histories offer valuable firsthand accounts of historical events. Several projects in Maine seek to capture the voices of people from all walks of life. Panelists will discuss the debate over the use of artificial intelligence in oral history research. VIP callers include Galen Koch, Steve Bromage, Nicole Morin-Scribner and Kevin Miller.

articles.title: Expense Account Cheaters Beware: James Bond GPT is Here
articles.author: Bob Goldman
articles.summary: Chatbot GPT can create fake receipts to use for bogus expense accounts. Expense account management systems like Expensify and AppZen have added AI detection enhancements to target AI-enhanced fake receipts created by powerful AI systems. About 13% of reported cases of occupational fraud investigated in the past year involved employees who submitted inflated or invented expenses.

articles.title: Artificial Intelligence.
articles.summary: Local NPR for the Cape, Coast & Islands is 90.1 91.1 94.3 on CRB Classical. Ben Pring, IT futurist and author, discusses the pros and cons of Artificial Intelligence and other technologies we should be paying attention to.

articles.title: AI-written police reports?
articles.author: CJ Baker
articles.summary: A growing number of law enforcement agencies around the country are using artificial intelligence tools to help write up their reports. However, Park County police chief Jim Rhea doesn't want to start using AI to issue citations or reports. In contrast, agencies in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, and Boulder, Colorado, have enthusiastically embraced the new technology. Enforcer is a productivity app offered by the Wisconsin-based SimpliWorx, dba Blue Line Logix.

articles.summary: People are worried that artificial intelligence will put them out of work. This article is available in full to subscribers only.
